H0.text: Cellulose is the primary structural material of plants that humans cannot digest, and it is one of the most abundant organic substances on earth.

H1.text: Sulfur is the primary structural material of plants that humans cannot digest and is one of the most abundant organic substances on earth.

H2.text: Carbonate is the primary structural material of plants that humans cannot digest, and it is one of the most abundant organic substances on earth.

H3.text: Zinc is the primary structural material of plants, one of the most abundant organic substances on Earth, that humans cannot digest.

A4.text: Cellulose is an important structural component of the cell walls of green plants, many forms of algae, and the oomycetes.

A5.text: Cellulose is the most abundant organic polymer on Earth.
